repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Petroleum Exploration Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Petroleum Exploration
            Technical Assistance Project for Kenya was satisfactory. The
            project achieved some of its objectives, its impact on
            institutional development was substantial, sustainability is
            likely, and the performance of the Bank was marginally
            satisfactory while the Borrower's was satisfactory.
            Several lessons can be learned from this project. First,
            closer supervision, the fielding of more missions with the
            required skills, and closer follow-up of all project
            components might have contributed to the better achievement
            of project objectives. Second, if the Bank was seriously
            interested in pursuing the objective of improving petroleum
            supply and distribution, this seriousness would have been
            reflected in the design and allocation of resources for the
            project. Finally, it is important to listen to the ultimate
            end-users, which were the IOCs in this project.

Kenya - Petroleum Exploration Technical

display_title.display_title:
Kenya - Petroleum Exploration

repnme.cdata!:
Kenya - Petroleum Exploration Technical
            Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Petroleum Exploration Technical
            Assistance Project will help accelerate petroleum
            exploration in Kenya by assisting the Government to: (i)
            strengthen its technical capability to negotiate production
            sharing agreements and supervise petroleum exploration; (ii)
            establish the information necessary to identify and open up
            new prospective areas for exploration; and (iii) promote and
            offer prospective acreage to interested oil companies and
            subsequently negotiate contracts and monitor the
            company's activities. These objectives would be
            accomplished through technical assistance, training,
            purchase of equipment, and geophysical data gathering.
